Reviews.Title: Nice basic television at a very reasonable price
Reviews.Author: Paul S. Remington
Reviews.Content: We purchased the LG 32LN5300 32" television for our toddler's playroom, so we didn't want anything too big or too expensive.  I looked at all our options and narrowed down my search to the LG 32LN5300 based on image quality, features, and price.  My basic requirements were that it had to be 1080P and offer at least two HDMI inputs.  There was one other television that was $50 less than the LG, but I opted for the LG because the image quality was noticeably better and off-axis viewing was far superior.  The other television was an Insignia.The first thing I'll say about the LG 32LN5300 is this television is mostly about image quality; the image quality is its most outstanding feature.  Like most flat-screen televisions, especially on the budget market, audio quality is not its strongest asset.It offers two 10W speakers (20W total) that produce a very nice volume that will easily fill a moderately sized room enough that you can probably hear it well in an adjacent room.  Don't expect to get a nice full-bodied sound with rich low end.  Its sonic body is thin.  With that said, the settings do offer the ability to tweak the audio and you can set the treble and bass.  This helps somewhat and lessons the boxy sound a bit.  Virtual surround settings also enhance the audio effect.  Just be aware that the audio quality is enough to get by, which makes it fine for a bedroom, den, or play room.  If you want added audio quality, consider purchasing a separate speaker system.Where this television excels in its price range is in image quality.  The monitor does an excellent job at projecting a clean image with crisp detail and very nice image contrast and color tone.  There is an abundance of expert settings that allow you to configure gamma levels and many other complex settings that most users will never know how to set.  Some of these settings can get you into trouble, so if you play with them, expect to possibly reset everything back to the factory default if you screw things up.  But don't be intimidated.  The settings are easy to access using the remote and all the basics are there: brightness, contrast, color, tint, backlighting, etc.After initially setting up the television, I wasn't overly pleased with the image quality.  After maybe twenty minutes of customization, I now have things configured and am very pleased with the image quality.  If image quality is important to you, expect to spend a little time configuring the settings to your liking and don't get upset if the first image you see isn't what you expected.  It's designed to allow for user configuration.This television is ideal for applications that don't require extra features or an abundant quantity of inputs and outputs.  The 32LN5300 comes with only two HDMI inputs, one on the back and one on the side.  If you're wall mounting the television, keep in mind that the back HDMI connector requires you to use an HDMI cable with a 90-degree connector or adapter.  If you don't, the television won't lay flush against the wall because the cable will get in the way.Along with two HDMI connectors, the television comes with one composite and one USB input.The 32LN5300 is Energy Star compliant and sips power at a rate of approximately $6 a year when the Eco setting is configured (default).There are a number of reviews that complain about faulty power issues.  Some of these reviews are related to purchasing used equipment.  I'm very concerned about this, but so far, we haven't experienced this problem, perhaps because we purchased it new.  If we do, I'll immediately update this review and report it here.  If you don't see any added update regarding this, our television is working fine.Overall, the LG 32LN5300 is a very nice basic television that produces a beautiful image.  The sound is a bit thin, but the audio can be configured to make the out-of-the-box settings a bit bolder.  It's not built for sound; it's build for economy of purchase and image quality.  We're very happy with the screen quality.  Based on our experience, we would recommend this television for those who need a basic set without an abundance of features or connections.

Reviews.Title: No frills, but probably the best TV in it's class for the price.
Reviews.Author: TronixSage
Reviews.Content: I purchased this TV for my 91 year old grandmother who decided it was time to spend a little money on herself (I purchased from Amazon and she reimbursed me). Before this, she was using a 27" JVC CRT that was nearing the end of its useful life since the screen kept getting progressively darker and any programming showing dark scenes was almost impossible to see (and that was with the brightness turned all the way up). At the same time, she was getting sick and tired of paying for basic cable service (about $25/mo) so I purchased a cheap RCA antenna (ANT111) to take advantage of the free OTA digital channels. She lives 5-7 miles from most of the towers and was able to pick up 39 digital channels with this antenna (she was previously only getting 10-15 channels from Time Warner).While searching for her new TV, I had to consider space and price. I felt that a 32" TV would have been too small and since I couldn't find any suitable options in the 35-37" range I started looking at the 40" TVs. Unfortunately, these were out of her budget probably due to their "smart" options - which she will never use and their 120Hz refresh rates. Also, I needed to keep the overall width of the TV to 35".I then turned my search to 39" models and narrowed it down to the Samsung UN39FH5000 and the LG 39LN5300. To make an extremely long story short, I have a grudge against Samsung because I've been burned so many times in the past (google "Samsung panel lottery"). It was hard for me to consider the Sammy, but I think it was the next best option to this LG (even though the Sammy was four bills and the LG was just over three).I had the TV shipped to my home so I could evaluate it prior to setting it up for her. Set up was easy and straight forward. Three Philips head machine screws attach the bracket to the base, the TV slips over the bracket and secures with four Philips head machine screws with washers.BUILD QUALITY (7/10): The build quality of this TV is above average if you consider its budget friendly price. I am only disappointed with the quality of the stand as it's as light as a feather and is made mostly from cheap plastic and a thin metal support strip. The stand for my Sony TV weighs 5 lbs and the one for my Panny weighs 10 lbs. Both are made from a combination of sturdy plastic and metal.HD PICTURE QUALITY (8/10): The HD picture quality is actually better than I was expecting. I tested the TV with my HD converter box and BluRay player in 1080p. The quality closely matched my Sony TV which cost three times as much. Some of the OTA channels are 720p and they look very good too. You won't be disappointed in the picture quality.UPCONVERTED PICTURE QUALITY (8/10): I think this category should be taken with a grain of salt since the upconverted quality is likely to differ between DVD/BD players. My Sony DVP-SR500H player does an average job (maybe a 6/10) while my Sony BDP-S590 player is above average (maybe an 8/10).SD PICTURE QUALITY (8/10): I was pleasantly surprised with the SD picture quality of this TV. It was much clearer compared to my Sony (both this LG and my Sony don't even come close to my Panny). Jaggies were hardly noticeable at all. Just remember, 8 out of 10 here looks really good and helps the overall score, but this is just a rating on the SD picture quality. If I had to compare the SD to HD picture quality, the SD would be somewhere around a 6 or 7 if the HD quality were a 10.MOTION BLUR & MOSQUITO NOISE (7.5/10): I watched a football game on ESPN and noticed some slight motion blur. It wasn't very bad or even distracting, but it was there. Also, I noticed some mosquito noise around the players. What really disappointed me was the motion artifact when watching cartoons. I watched an episode of Family Guy and every time the camera moved the picture shook which was annoying. This annoying level of artifact was present when I streamed the first episode of Under the Dome especially during the part where the dome came down and Barbie witnessed the cow getting sliced in half. What an awesome show btw.SCREEN UNIFORMITY (7/10): There are a few bright strips that run the entire vertical length of the screen on the far left and right sides. These bright strips fade significantly when the backlight and brightness are turned down. They are more noticeable if viewing 45 degrees or more from center, less noticeable when viewing from center.BANDING (8.5/10): This TV does suffer from banding issues, but it's only noticeable when white backgrounds are displayed or probably less than 5% of the time. I watched a few hours of cable programming the other night while testing this TV and only noticed it very briefly.COLOR (7/10): Right out of the box I felt the color on this set was slightly faded or washed out. Now, this isn't necessarily a bad thing, but I prefer my colors to have a little more pop. I did try calibrating the color and that helped immensely. Out of the box rating would have been a 5.SOUND QUALITY (7/10): Right out of the box I would have given this TV a 5 for sound. After tweaking the ClearVoice settings and using the "music" mode, I was pleasantly surprised that my grandmother could actually hear this TV. It is much clearer than her old JVC and actually filled her 12x12 room with plenty of sound (volume level between 10-15). Bass was initially set to 50, I increased it to 75 and might do so again because this thing really lacks depth. ***update*** As of lately, my grandmother has been having a hard time making out the dialogue so I purchased her a sound bar with front facing speakers. The sound bar was an immediate improvement over the TV speakers.REMOTE (9/10): Most HDTVs that I've owned or purchased for friends and relatives come with remotes that are absolutely huge and oddly shaped. This remote is quite compact and fits very comfortably in my hand. Unfortunately, with a compact remote the buttons are closer together and this remote feels a bit crowded. I would think that even after sufficient time of getting used to this remote, the user could accidently hit some of the buttons if they weren't watching what they were doing or if they were using the remote in a dark environment. It would have been nice if the remote had backlit buttons.OVERVIEW: As I mentioned, this TV is for my 91 year old grandmother. It is the largest TV she has ever owned, but probably not the most expensive. The look on her face when I pulled it out of the box was priceless - I don't think she ever imagined having a TV this large and this nice for the budget friendly price.MY RATING:Build Quality 7.0/10HD Picture Quality 8.0/10Upconverted Picture Quality  8.0/10SD Picture Quality 8.0/10Motion Blur/Mosquito Noise 7.5/10Screen Uniformity 7.0/10Banding 8.5/10Color 7.0/10Sound Quality 7.0/10Remote 9.0/10Total 77/100

Reviews.Title: LG 39LN5300
Reviews.Author: Chris_PHS89
Reviews.Content: I purchased the 39 inch. First impressions. Picture is excellent without making any adjustments. I have it hooked up to Directv through the HDMI input. I watched a movie on a non HD channel and the picture looked almost as good as an HD channel. I think the TV has some kind of up converter built in.Common with most flat screen TV's the speakers are under the front of the TV and sound is less than impressive. I compare the sound to listen to something through a tin can. Plan to get a sound bar in the next few weeks.So far I really like this TV. As always Amazon's price was by far the lowest.  Got one for $314.99 it was originally 387.99 but Amazon marked it down several times. I would buy another one if I had anywhere to put it.Update 7/17/13I have had this TV for a few weeks now. I was worried about buying a 60hz TV but no trouble what so ever. I have watched NASCAR, Baseball, Football and all other types of programing. I see no motion blurring at all on this TV. The picture is just amazing. Crisp, clear and the color is really good. Thats without any adjustments. I'm using the standard picture setting and have the energy saver set on low. Have not purchased a sound bar yet. Adjusted some of my sound settings and is a little better. Some channels have really good sound and some don't. DVD's have good sound. And speaking of DVD the picture quality looks as good if not better than Directv's 720p and 1080i HD. The DVD picture quality is so good I have not even considered a Blu Ray player. I have my DVD player hooked up through the component input. The Blue Green and Red. Really happy with this purchase.

Reviews.Title: 2 Different TV's with the same problem of turning off
Reviews.Author: Gadgetman "Gadgetman"
Reviews.Content: This was my fourth LG TV and I really wanted to like this.  I have three other LG TV's in the following sizes, 32", 47" and 55".  This is the 2013 year model and my other TV's were from 2011 and 2012.  When the TV arrived I unpacked the boxed and noticed a 4" x 4" bracket that was not listed in the manual.  After looking at it again, I noticed that it was a Joey mounting bracket from DishNetwork's Hopper system!!!  Now how did that get in there?  It was even wrapped in the white foam like the rest of the TV.  After looking closer at the box, there was two rows of tape on the top of the box sealing it closed.  I hooked up the TV and it powered on for about 4 seconds and then turned off.  After 1/2 of trying to get the TV to stay on, I called LG's support and they were of no help.  After changing to a different power cord, the TV would stay on for 4 minutes and then turn off for 15 seconds and then back on.  The next morning I tried it again and it would not stay on for more than 4 minutes without turning off.  My final thoughts were that this must have been returned and somehow reshipped out.  So I had this TV returned and a replacement sent.  The next TV did the same thing!!  Agh! I decided to move this TV to another room with a different Sat Receiver and HDMI cable just to make sure there wasn't a problem in that room.  The results were the same.  8-(.  I hooked up my old TV and it is working great, so it is not a power or Sat problem.  The 30 day support from Amazon was refreshing!!  No over seas support and they were located in Oregon.  The tech went through the usual fixes for this type of problem and it looks like another defective TV.  Thumbs up to Amazon and their return process, but thumbs down for this model so far.  I did notice that this model is stripped down in that it will not play video through the USB port like two of my other LG TVs.  It looks like the newer models will not play video unless it is a higher end version unlike last years models.  8-(  What's up with this LG????  I will most likely check out the Samsung version of this TV now.  On a side note, when I could get this TV to power on, the picture looked much better than the Vizio 26" model it was replacing, but the Vizio got the last laugh as lest it would stay on! <G>

Reviews.Title: Purchased 12. Two failed within 24 hours of use.
Reviews.Author: Remy
Reviews.Content: I purchased 12 of these TVs for business. One of them failed after only about 6 hours of use another about 24 hours. The problem with both TVs is the same: It turns itself off and if you restart it it stays on for a short time and turns itself off again. One of the TVs turned itself off and on and ultimately failed to turn on again. There is at least one other buyer who experienced this problem. When the first TV failed I replied to his posting. You can read it under his post. I decided to create a new post after the second TV failed. 2 out of 12 is a very high failure rate. I am very disappointed. The TVs I purchased are the 42" version. I will try to return all of them. I will post my experience with Amazon after I speak with them. I would not buy this model again and I can not recommend this model based on my experience.

Reviews.Title: If your looking for a great gaming tv, look no futher
Reviews.Author: Bucknuts07
Reviews.Content: I purchased this tv about 2 weeks ago as I saw on avsforums.com that a few early adopters were really talking this tv up. I gotta say that i'm 100% satisfied with this tv. I purchased the 32" to use as an office gaming tv, as well as a monitor for my macbook pro. In both cases, it performs extremely well. First of all as a gamer, its hard to find a tv in todays times that has low input lag. While I dont have a testing device, I can tell you that this tv has very little input lag. As a barometer, I have a Panasonic tc-l37e3, which is supposed to be one of the lowest tv's for input lag, around 10ms, this tv is right there, and feels every bit as responsive, but it also has much better black levels. This tv puts out a great picture. I saw a couple reviews for this tv, which had really nothing to do with this tv's performance, so I thought it was important to post this review.

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: Hoopshots
Reviews.Content: I haven't had any of the problems that other people have talked about.  I left the TV on for 2 weeks straight and it never shut off.  The frame is fairly thin which makes the screen even look bigger, the colors are bright and the remote works really well.  The sound is good as well.  I initially started looking at 39" sets as they were lower cost but when I saw them at the store next to a 42" they looked to be wide and short compared to the normal look of a TV set.  If you have a chance to get this set, I highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: Not Suitable for Old People
Reviews.Author: Keith Otis Edwards "Keith Otis Edwards"
Reviews.Content: There's good news and bad news in the television department. I was pleased that this LG set cost about half of what I paid for my previous TV, a Samsung LED that became unusable after only five years, but there's a reason why the unit is so inexpensive.I chose an LG after reading a magazine article by the celebrated author Nicholson Baker praising LG as the leading manufacturer of flat-screen displays. In it, he reveals that LG makes the displays for most Apple products, including their touted Retina Display, as well as other brands of hand-held devices, but I confess that I can't really discern much difference in the picture quality between this set and my old Samsung or, for that matter, other new LCD televisions I've seen. It provides a fine, bright display (if adjusted properly), but they're all pretty good to my fading vision that was once satisfied with CRT TV.In addition to a good picture, buyers also want features and ease of use. The LG remote control comes with an INFO button that displays the title of a program or movie and how long the show is scheduled to run. Being a compulsive channel surfer, I like that.Very few TV sets that I've seen of late come with internal stereo speakers that produce impressive sound, and the internal speakers of the LG are worse than those of any TV set I've ever owned. The internal audio amplifier puts out a measily 10 watts at 10% distortion! Not a good choice for viewing concerts.The reason manufacturers skimp on the quality of internal speakers is that owners who desire theater-quality sound have their set connected to an external audio system. Those who have spent extravagant sums on audio typically have the latest 5.1-channel Dolby(tm) system and an array of speakers, but my high-end system, which I'm still satisfied with, is older and merely handles two-channel stereo.This creates a problem, because one of the reasons that the new sets have come down in price is that they've eliminated the large array of input and output jacks on the back of the set. That's true not just of this LG, but all the consumer-grade low-priced sets I looked at have only the minimum of inputs and outputs.  There are RCA-phono input receptacles for an old-fashioned DVD player, but gone are sockets for connecting a VCR. (Which is now as obsolete as an 8-track, and it's time you sent all those treasured video tapes to the landfill.)  There are two HDMI inputs, but one is on the side, which may or may not suit your instalation. I'll refer you to other reviews here to illustrate the shortcomings of the single USB port.The only audio output, and the only way to connect the set to a decent sound system, is through a single digital optical audio port which accepts a fiberoptic Toslink Cable.  (Amazon has a good price on one.)  That was no problem for me, because I've been using the optical audio output on my Mac for years, and with a quality external digital-to-analog convertor, there is a satisfying improvement in sound.Digital-to-analog convertors have also come down in cost, and Amazon also has good prices on them (though many are sold through independent sellers).  But when I connected the LG 32LN5300 to a standard D/A convertor and to my stereo system, I got no sound at all!  This is where the fun began.The magazine article I mentioned above touted LG's devotion to customer satisfaction, and I'm here to say that's udder buncombe. (I also remembered that I never cared for any of Nicholson Baker's novels either.) My first three posted messages to LG's customer support site resulted in replies that were of no help whatsoever. It is impossible to reply to LG's messages, so each attempt at solving the problem meant starting from scratch at their website. When I phoned the LG help desk, I confess that I lost my temper when the fellow suggested that I had to instead call the maker of the D/A convertor, and ask >them< if their convertor is compatible with LG products. That's a typical ploy of poor customer service: fob the customer off onto another company.In response to my fourth message, I was finally informed that the audio output of the LG 32LN5300 is in the Dolby AC3 format.  This specification is not given in the owner's manual nor at the LG website.  Amazon to the rescue again, and I purchased a Panlong Optical SPDIF/ Coaxial Digital to Analog RCA Audio Decoder Converter that worked . . . sometimes.Depending on whether the source is in the Dolby format the sound from my external audio system is sometimes annoyingly delayed so that it is obviously not in sync with the picture. Sometimes the external audio is not available at all, which requires shutting off the TV and turning it back on. Beware that if you plan on connecting the LG 32LN5300 to an external audio system that's in mere stereo, you will have unsolvable problems.I will assume that another defect of the LG 32LN5300 would also apply mostly to older users, but if you are among those of us who yet get your TV signal from broadcast sources, as opposed to cable TV, this set's tuner is poor. If I were to stand on the roof of my home, I could see the transmitter towers of the local stations on the horizon, but sometimes the LG's tuner picks their signals up from my rooftop antenna . . .  and sometimes it doesn't.  With the popularity of cable TV, LG apparently figured, pess on `em, and they could get by with a cheap tuner.And for guys, it's essential that the remote control be responsive and easy to use. The LG remote, however, is flaky and requires fiddling. Switching input sources is an ordeal which requires the use of both hands. Accidentally hitting a wrong button requires scrolling down to an on-screen EXIT button to close a window. If you have virtuoso remote skills, guys, you will not be satisfied with the LG instrument.It's a cheap set, and you gets what you pays for. As with automobiles in the 1980s, the goal of designers of home electronics today seems to be not to make the product better, but to make it cheaper and hence more profitable.FOLOW-UP REPORT:  After a mere six months, the ON/OFF switch on the LG remote control stopped working. The workaround to this defect is to tune to a channel with no signal (there is no Channel One, so I use that), then the set will eventually turn itself off after a while. I can then turn it back on using any other key.Remember when Made-in-America appliances like Zenith worked for ten or twenty years without needing repairs?

Reviews.Title: died 32 days after it arrived.
Reviews.Author: J. Rhoden "faulkton"
Reviews.Content: Was a great picture until it started just turning off by itself intermittently with the red LG light flashing. Amazon handled the situation wonderfully, as always, but i'm glad i bought the squaretrade because i have a feeling i'll end up using it.

Reviews.Title: Cheap
Reviews.Author: Don Miguel "The Bookie"
Reviews.Content: Worked for awhile and had great picture quality but after 3 weeks the TV just kept turning off and on incessantly. Tried to trouble shoot but to no avail. It appears that after the TV got to a certain temperature (after so many hours of viewing) something would just start shorting out. Looked online to see if this problem was frequent but didn't find anything. I'm thinking something may have been damaged during shipping but who really knows. I'm just glad I was able to get a refund.

Reviews.Title: Item turns on and off by itself
Reviews.Author: Fabulman
Reviews.Content: After few minutes being on, the TV itself decide turned off without any reason and on again after long time... possibly because of the Eco Motion Sensor must be harmed.

Reviews.Title: Wonderful TV
Reviews.Author: Patrick A. Zech
Reviews.Content: I bought this TV for use in our master bedroom. I couldn't be happier with this LG. The picture quality is amazing, even on non HD channels and the TV looks very nice. It is a very thin and light TV which is a nice plus. I also love that LG sets allow you to turn off the picture but leave the sound on for energy savings. We use this feature frequently when listening to Pandora or Slacker Radio. For this price, I couldn't recommend a better buy.

Reviews.Title: Good value.
Reviews.Author: JOHN PERFETTI
Reviews.Content: Crystal clear images, audio is ok.  Easy to set up,  and menu controls easy to understand and adjust.  Highly recommend this product.

Reviews.Title: Review of 39 in set - only $15 more than 32"
Reviews.Author: Steven I. Ramm "Steve Ramm "Anything Phon...
Reviews.Content: My 35 year old trusty Sony  26" Trinatron (with a large tube and great sound - but weighing 185 pounds!) was taking up too much room and so I bit the bullet and started looking at flat screens. I did a lot of research on Amazon and elsewhere and was lead to this set. I also went to Best Buy to see it in person.  My old set had a 15 inch high image and was 4:3aspect. To get the same height image in a wide screen for an old 26" set you need a 32 in wide screen (16:9). And that's  what looked at. The price on Amazon was $299. But then I saw that the 39 in one was only $314. - $15 more - and got that.I knew going in - because of seeing models in stores - that NO thin flat screen has the sound of a CRT TV. The speakers are always in rear and they are tiny. And case of the old Sony was wood, while this is plastic. So I knew I might need to add a sound bar ($100-$150) but I haven't yet.I've had this set for 3 weeks and am very happy with it. The picture is great though I had to tweak the brightness on some. Let me add here that I do not have cable - I use a rooftop antenna and get clear pictures. I bought a new BD player as well (Samsung for about $69.) Review posted separately (see my "other reviews") In fact we liked this set so much we bought another a few days later for bedroom.It was easy to set up and you don't need to "calibrate" the image. If you choose the Aspect Display to be "as determined by program" it will automatically put the black bars where they need to be. Some shows are not 16:9 and many folks want to fill their screen so they stretch the image and everyone on screen looks fat. Black bars on the left and right side mean that the image is correct and that is acceptable - especially when watching old tv shows or older films.The first purchase was for my Media room where I sit about 6-8 feet away from set. So I didn't need a larger one - even 42 inches would be too big. For value I think this was the best deal and can recommend it.If it has one downside - really minor - it that the remote is not lit so I'm learning by feel which buttons do what. I wear reading glasses and still have to put them on periodically to see what the button labels say.I hope you found this review both informative and helpful.Steve Ramm"Anything Phonographic"

Reviews.Title: BIG fan of LG . However . . .
Reviews.Author: Joseph C. Johnson "JCJ"
Reviews.Content: I've always been a fan of LG and Samsung electronics.  Either one will always give you great quality and performance. I've got 3 LG HDTV's and 2 Samsung and they are all great!  Until now.  Ordered this LG from Amazon to replace a 32" Samsung in the bedroom, since it was the oldest HD we own and it is only a 720P.After installation and a LOT of tweaking of various settings I finally got the picture and sound to resemble a mid grade brand 720P from several years ago.  Wow.  The 5 year old Samsung I was replacing had a MUCH better picture and flawless sound. I'm really considering swapping them back and sending this lemon back.What a disappointment from LG.

Reviews.Title: Defective upon arrival
Reviews.Author: douglas v.
Reviews.Content: No problem with Amazon at all. Came quickly, but when hooked up, had red and green dots and lines all over the screen. Contacted LG factory service. They said it was one of two major internal parts, both of which would have to be ordered. Returned and got refund quickly.

Reviews.Title: Not easily wall mounted, plus...
Reviews.Author: schuess "schuess"
Reviews.Content: This unit has 2 built in speakers that cause the back of the TV panel to raise out. This got in the way of my universal TV mount. I could have gotten in to work if i wanted to see two bars reaching above the top of the TV, which i did not. This was a deal breaker for me. It has the mounting holes, but like i said, would not mount for me.Also, i find the inputs and AC plug areas to be pour in design, especially the AC adapter. The plugs are forced to bend near the connection and I worry about damaging cables or the TV.Pros. Picture Quality and Price.Cons. Poor Design for Wall mounting , and AC Input

Reviews.Title: Great picture, great value
Reviews.Author: Alans Gutierrez
Reviews.Content: I got this for my younger siblings to replace an older TV they had and it looks great! I was also able to mount it and it was very easy to do. It is very light but also very sturdy. I've hooked up their computer to it so they have it as a second monitor and when they watch netflix or play videos on it they are able to view it in high definition. They love it!

Reviews.Title: LG Electronics LN5300 39LN5300 39-Inch LED-lit 1080p 60Hz TV
Reviews.Author: William J. Weisensee
Reviews.Content: Not too much to say.  I bought this TV to use in my work out room for when I ride an Exercycle.  I mounted the TV to the wall using the "VideoSecu LCD LED TV Wall Mount Full Motion with Swivel Articulating Arm for 23-37 in, up to 42 in TV Monitor Flat Panel Screen With VESA 200 100, 20 in Extension and Post-installation Leveling System ML531B M84".  I have a Blu ray player as the input and the resolution on this TV is phenomenal.  The price is great and the video quality is excellent.

Reviews.Title: Broken - but a LG technician fixed it in-home, for free!
Reviews.Author: Lucas J.
Reviews.Content: Great TV for the price. Clear, crisp 1080p image quality without a lot of compression artifacts from high-motion video. Be aware, it does not come with an RCA output for audio - only an optical Toslink port. If you're trying to connect it to an older analog stereo, you'll need a DAC. The audio's decent for flat-panel speakers: not too high-pitched, not too weak. Also there's only 2 HDMI ports and one component input which doubles as an RCA input - this is pretty standard these days.Anyway, after unpacking it, my TV repeatedly shut off and turned on again while watching most video sources. Seemed to happen more with high-def streams. I bought it before I moved, so it was outside the 30-day Amazon return window.I called LG's hotline on Sunday afternoon, expecting a runaround, and was instead given an appointment that Tuesday for a technician to come to my house and fix it. He identified the problem and fixed it on the spot in about ten minutes. Ever since, it's worked very well. Thoroughly impressed with their support team.

Reviews.Title: Different spec as it is mentioned
Reviews.Author: Amir
Reviews.Content: I bought this LED TV based on the specs that is mentioned in LG official website ([...] They are claiming that the USB connection can playback movies in DIVX and MPEG format (in the Technical Specification tab). In reality, it can only play photos and music. It was a big shameful lie from LG to sell its product.

Reviews.Title: Perfect
Reviews.Author: Lexi Rae
Reviews.Content: This TV was exactly what I wanted and it works perfectly, I'm so glad I found it. It was easy and convenient to set up and it's light enough to carry around. I got it for my college dorm for my first year and it's perfect sized. I would say the 1080p makes a big difference, too.

Reviews.Title: Can't speak for new but make SURE you don't buy used.
Reviews.Author: John Diche "JD"
Reviews.Content: Amazon quality checked this television and resold it but this can't be possible. Once I plugged the set in I had problems within 1 minute.  The television cuts on, cuts off, randomly. Goes for moments with the red light at bottom flashing then spontaneously cuts back on. Then will cut back off. On and off over and over again. This is the last used set I will buy.  Funny thing is I thought I was buying a new set at the time I made the purchase. There are two sections one says "used", the other says "new". This television was in the new section. So apparently there are some bugs in the shopping interface.

Reviews.Title: Save your money, get something better.
Reviews.Author: C. Manning
Reviews.Content: I purchased this tv in June, and it was okay when I first set it up, the picture wasn't anything to write home about; but it was good enough. About 2 months later however; I began noticing horizontal white lines during dark scenes on the tv. It becomes a lot orse when there is movement on screen. It is getting progressively worse as the days go on. LG basically told me I was screwed, so here I am. The firmware isn't even upgradeable without having a technician come out to do it for you, the usb port is STRICTLY photo and music only.  Do not purchase this tv, save your money for something nicer, it is not worth the headache.

Reviews.Title: Excellent as PC Monitor, Do NOT buy a used one - it may shut off by itself
Reviews.Author: math-tutorchicago-org
Reviews.Content: I wanted to use this LG TV mainly as a computer monitor. You have to name the input to PC - it will make the PC picture look way better. It worked nicely 2-3 days - nice colors, contrast, crisp text, and many settings available to tweak the picture saturation, hue, contrast etc. The sound is not as clear as Vizio but is ok.I was able to set the color temperature to C20 which makes the white cool (blue hue) on a webpage or a document. This is how white is supposed to look in my opinion, not some grey or yellowish white I've seen on other monitors.After a few days the TV started to shut itself off. It seems that after some time working it 'overheats' or something shortcuts and it shuts off. Then it turns on again randomly. Then off again.Setting the clock, as someone here suggested, did not solve the issue. It's simply faulty - the same problem repeats as a PC monitor, as a TV, and when hooked to my laptop.Looks like there is a bunch of faulty TV's out there that are being resold without proper checkup. Mine is "used, as new" and is going back. If you buy one of those, make sure it is not used or you are running a high risk of getting a faulty one.Update September 30th: I got the same model, NEW in the box, from a local seller. It works without any problems and I chose it over Samsung UN32EH5300, because the LG has more settings available to tweak when used as a PC monitor and the picture looks way fresher and overall better on LG.

Reviews.Title: Terrific TV for the money.
Reviews.Author: Audresews
Reviews.Content: I purchased this TV as a Valentine's gift for my husband to to replace the analog in his 'man cave'.  I don't sit and watch it for long periods but every time I have walked into the room I have been struck by the terrific picture.  It seems sharper than the Samsung in our family room with the same HD specs.  The sound quality is very good--not tinny at all as some reviewers have said.  We are very happy with the purchase.

Reviews.Title: Excellent as a large computer monitor
Reviews.Author: R.G.
Reviews.Content: I normally don't write reviews but this was great enough to make an exception. I was looking for a 32 inch tv suitable for use as a computer monitor for work and play as part of a multiple monitor setup. I read that this tv could label the hdmi input source as a pc connection and the tv would factor this in to its image settings to make text appear at least as clear as it would on a normal computer monitor and it worked perfectly. I can work with large amounts of text, spreadsheets, posters, and databases as well as I can stream movies and play games with great colors. Text appears as clear as it does on my previous 27 inch pc monitor, not grainy at all like on some tvs.The tv passes the black level, gamma saturation, contrast, and white saturation level tests at Lagom. The Lagom LCD test benchmarks image quality for lcd monitors.Another attribute factored into my rating is that the tv is quiet (no loud components). I've tried using a large tv as a monitor before but could not tolerate it because of a loud buzzing "hum" coming from the backlight of the television constantly.

Reviews.Title: Decent but has drawbacks
Reviews.Author: Maximus
Reviews.Content: I purchased this product in January of '14.  It worked without issue for the first 4 months of owning; however, it did develop an issue where it would turn on and off repeatedly, in an inescapable loop. After a quick Google search of this issue, it appears that this is a known problem with this product.  The power supply has been known on LG TVs to fail.  I was lucky (or unlucky, depending on view point) to have my model last 4 months.  Others have, apparently, failed after 2 weeks or less.  My TV failed after the return window through AMAZON.  I have called LG technical support, and they issued a repair technician to address the issue.  Hopefully that will correct whatever internal component is failing.  Be aware of this issue, as it is a recurring problem with the 2013 production models.The TV is beautiful and I would highly recommend, if the internal component failure / power supply issue was repaired.EDIT:As mentioned above, LG sent a repair technician to repair the internal component failure.  The repair technician was able to change out the internal components and reassemble the TV within 15 minutes, and LG covered the cost of repair.

Reviews.Title: Great for use as PC display
Reviews.Author: C. Guella
Reviews.Content: I chose this display to add a 3rd display to my computer.  I had read that how some LG TVs increase perceived pixel density using  4:4:4 chroma mapping to allow computer images to display without pixelating.  I found this to be true on this TV and it is a perfectly adequate display for computer graphics at 39 inches.  I am not sure how good of a TV it is since I am using it primarily as a PC display but through HDMI it is working great when compared to other TVs I tried in the class that did not resolve the computer images as well as the 39LN5300.  I am sure there are some tehcnical reasons that would make other TVs do an even better job but not for the price - as far as I can tell.

Reviews.Title: good picture,lame sound
Reviews.Author: Bill Chastain
Reviews.Content: picture great, but sound crappy and worst of all, no analog audio out! nor even a headphone jack. the optical audio accessories I've seen are almost as expensive as the set. bogus

Reviews.Title: nice picture quality
Reviews.Author: libpekin
Reviews.Content: This is a great LED TV to get if you're looking for great picture quality display. It was cheaper on Amazon than other online stores so I decided to buy it there and it worked out well because the person I bought it fore was in loved with the picture quality and slimness.

Reviews.Title: Not a good TV
Reviews.Author: Tim Harper "TornadoTJ"
Reviews.Content: I have had this for less than a month. Since it's in the guest bedroom, it rarely gets used. After 3 weeks, it's dead, will not turn on at all. The picture was never very good anyway, fuzzy. I've ordered a replacement, we will see how that one works out. If it's as bad, I'll be getting something else.

Reviews.Title: Most TV for your money.
Reviews.Author: Steven Wallace
Reviews.Content: I am pleased with nearly everything about this Television. The picture is excellent and has plenty of display settings to play with. In fact, since the screen is so incredibly bright, it produces an acceptable picture even in direct sunlight. The remote feels good 'n substantial, and has everything you'll need. The on board speakers are average, but good enough to use if you don't have/want external audio  (I bought a sound bar w/ sub).The biggest drawbacks for me are the relatively few (2) HDMI ports, that those ports lack  HDMI-CEC support [Sorry Chromecasters, no automatic input switching :-( ], and the lack of any audio out other than an optical port.The bottom line is that if you have $400 to spend on a TV, this is, by far, the biggest and best you can get. I love it.

Reviews.Title: Nice TV
Reviews.Author: konrad
Reviews.Content: This TV is dope. I found it on amazon for 398.00 no tax no shipping, bam 398. I couldn't be happier with the tv unless it started dancing around the room in excitment with me.

Reviews.Title: Great tv for gaming
Reviews.Author: Javier H C
Reviews.Content: This tv is great for playing video games the graphics look really good on the playstation 4 there is no log at all

Reviews.Title: LOVE this tv!
Reviews.Author: Jerilyn J. Lee "Jerilyn"
Reviews.Content: I bought this one to replace a Samsung 32" that I bought 3 days ago -- and spent 2 1/2 days trying to tweak the color, the contrast, the brightness, etc., etc., etc.  Never could get it right.  I finally put it back in the box for return.  I ordered the LG, plugged the cable wires in, turned in on, and I was watching it immediately!  I didn't have to tweak one picture component!!  The picture is sharp and clean.  The only thing I did tweak was the sound, and that's inherent to all of the smaller flat screen televisions.  The speakers are tiny, and give off a very "tinny" sound.  I increased the bass, decreased the treble, and changed it to Cinema mode.  Sounds good.  Not as good as stereo surround-sound, but good.  This television also has the sturdiest stand that I've seen on a 32".  I am VERY pleased with this purchase.

Reviews.Title: Great
Reviews.Author: L. S. TURNER "lst1950"
Reviews.Content: Picture is perfect.  I liked it so much, I ordered a larger one for my den.  LG really made a great product.

Reviews.Title: Great RV replacement
Reviews.Author: David W Carter
Reviews.Content: Bought as replacement for 26" in my RV. Due to very small bezel it fit in the frame that was made to fit 26".  Very easy to set up, works well with my sound system & Blueray.  Don't have any negative comments but then I am not a gamer, have old eyes (yes, I do remember B & W, big house top antennas & getting only 2 channels with snow most of the time) and am pretty easy to please.

Reviews.Title: Slightly annoyed
Reviews.Author: Jeremiah McLarty
Reviews.Content: The tv is good, but setting up was a pain.It was missing 3 of the screws to attach the tv to the stand so I had to go to the hardware store and get replacements. Nothing too big, just annoying.

Reviews.Title: A good TV
Reviews.Author: Filippo
Reviews.Content: Excellent tv. It has everything I've expected. I just wish they could put on more HDMI ports. The sound could be better.

Reviews.Title: Great TV from a great company
Reviews.Author: Drew Kissling
Reviews.Content: I picked this TV up on a pre black Friday deal for $268.  I couldn't ask for a better quality of LED tv for that price.  LG is definitely one of the top brands in this category and it shows in the product.  I got the 32" for my gaming tv.  Picture quality is beautiful.  Sound is just ok but thats to be expected with a flat screen, wasn't expecting to be blown away.  The virtual surround sound sounds pretty good in the 120 sq ft room I have this tv in.  I highly recommend this tv to anyone looking at it, you wont be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: What is expected.
Reviews.Author: Dakota Cox
Reviews.Content: a good tv for the money. great in my college dorm. great quality for gaming and watching. i recommend it

Reviews.Title: Amazing
Reviews.Author: CARLOS SIARL
Reviews.Content: The picture is amazing .This tv fulfills all my expectations and for the price I will recommend to anyone

Reviews.Title: Very good TV good Priceee
Reviews.Author: Albeiro Jose Martinez Castellanos
Reviews.Content: Im choose this product because it's a very good TV, Im like it LG, also this price was very few, the picture it's very very beatefull

Reviews.Title: Big improvements in picture quality for 2013
Reviews.Author: Ben
Reviews.Content: Summary*Never been a better time to sell your old TV and upgrade to a new TV*Huge improvements in picture quality over 2010 LED HDTV for streaming Amazon Prime, Netflix and Blu-Ray DVD*Bought 2013 LG 39" LED HDTV 1080p 60Hz for ~$350 on Amazon Warehouse deals in Very Good condition*Sold 2010 Samsung LED HDTV 32" 1080p 60Hz for $250 on Amazon in Very Good condition Samsung UN32C5000 32-Inch 1080p 60 Hz LED HDTV (Black)*Net cost of upgrade $100*Original cost of Samsung was $650 = cost to own 2011-2013 ~$400 or $200 per year after selling for $250*Additional savings expected from new TV due to better energy star rating = lower power usageThis TV was a replacement for a 2010 Samsung 32" LED TV  that I sold. Buying the TV used through Amazon Warehouse deals, I was able to get it for only about  $350 after selling my 2010 Samsung for $250, i.e. only $100 for the upgrade which is huge. For $100, I went from 32" to 39" and picture quality is so much better that it is making me want to watch more movies. Both TV's are 1080p with 60hz refresh. I cannot say enough about how impressed I am with the LG picture quality. It makes me think that there must have been big improvements in chip design over the past few years. At the same time prices came way down. When I bought my 32" Samsung in 2011, it cost $650. Now for $350, I am able to get an albeit used TV that is way better for only $350. A note here is that the manufacture date on the LG was July 2013, the same month that I received the TV. In other words, this 'used' TV was fresh off the manufacturing line in Mexico. When buying used products through Amazon Warehouse deals, my suggestion is to pay the extra $10 or $20 to get the items in Very Good condition but not Like New. Mine was listed as Very Good and it was so new that the protective plastic strips were still on the sides of the TV. The problem with Like New is that prices are basically the same as New. If you want a deal and do not want to get an overused product, go for Very Good.

Reviews.Title: Great so far!
Reviews.Author: Michael Slomka
Reviews.Content: TV has been great so far! Amazing picture, surprisingly good sound and no problems (some complained about it shutting off at random, but it has not done that for me). Very good product and name for a very good price.

Reviews.Title: Great LED
Reviews.Author: jaysun
Reviews.Content: I took a risk ordering this online, as I have ever only bought TVs in the store so I can see their brightness, crispness, etc.  I have been thoroughly pleased with this LG. The customizations for the display and audio are great and allow for a personalized mix. My PS3, Blu-Rays and cable all look  and sound great on it and I love the time feature that sets it to turn off at a certain time each night as I like to fall asleep with the TV on.

Reviews.Title: I am very happy with this product
Reviews.Author: Mohammed S Ahmed
Reviews.Content: The TV tuner, picture quaility, price and over all it is an excellent item. I saw some reviews that it stopped working after few minutes, I did not experince any thing like that. In some reviews people liked everything except the audio. But I am perfectly happy with the audio. I bought it 3 weeks ago. I mounted it on a wall. So far I did not encounter any problem.

Reviews.Title: Greaet Television
Reviews.Author: Morphling
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent TV overall.  I received it as gift for father's day and according to my wife, was on a super special price at a local store.  Obviously some reviewers have issues with the TV turning on/off or failing to work at all.  Mine (knock on wood) is solid after 2 months of owning it.  I'm pleased with everything it offers and at the start here I'll state - it's a great looking television with enough features you need and nothing extra that's useless.The good - First and foremost, the picture on this is excellent which is what you mainly want of your TV.  It's obviously 1080 and looks very sharp and clear.  Others have commented it's not sharp up close... well as TVs go up in size, they're meant to be viewed farther away... anyway.  The picture (once adjusted, more below) looks fantastic with colors being pretty true, details are sharp, and blacks/greys look good even in a dark scene.  It has direct LED which is overall better than edge-lit for most reasons.  Sure, this TV won't win any skinny contests by today's standards, but going back even 10 years this thing is small!  I'm fine with a 2'' thick TV.The refersh rate being only 60hz is fine by me.  My mother has the previous years LG TV but a higher end one with the 120hz and it either looks worse or the same to me.  If you watch programs that look better with 120hz, look elsewhere, but for me watching regular movies and TV shows it works well.  And it doesn't look like a soap opera half the time.The interface and remote are pretty easy to use - very little explanation and you can navigate stuff well.  Switching inputs is easy, channels, etc.  The remote works well and the TV responds well which isn't always the case.  Even my non-tech savvy mother in law figured it out without an explanation.  Setting it up was easy and the ports are well laid out with no issue getting to them or plugging something in.  I only need 2 HDMI inputs - one for Roku and one for the bluray.  The gaming system is hooked up through analog HD which is fine for me so most of the inputs are used and none are bad.  I know some may need more, but don't complain about it... it's clear in the write-up what ports this has.  Purchase an HDMI splitter for less than $10 if you NEED more.The bad - Most of the bad doesn't outweight the incredible value this TV offers and most of it is honestly typical to any TV today.To begin with - the speakers are terrible as they are on any TV.  TVs have thankfully gotten small but in return, the speakers on them must be small too.  Well, the physics of making noise that sounds good hasn't changed so the smaller speakers we have today sound worse than ever.  I wish they would remove them to make it even lighter, cheaper, and one less point of failure.  You can spend $100 on a regular stereo amp these days and another $100 for 2 bookshelf speakers and it will sound great.  It's honestly not a lot and works way better for you movies, music, etc.The next bad is a bit more annoying.  When you adjust the picture (brightness, color, contrast, tint) you MUST do it for each input.  I guess some people may have applications where adjusting each input can be beneficial but as far as I found out, LG didn't give me the option to at least set it the same for all inputs.  So, when I finally go the picture right for one setting, I had to write the numbers down and go punch it in for the next.  Keep the ability but give an option to 'apply to all'.The last is the worst one.  I know from reading the write-up it only had optical audio out but it's very odd this doesn't also have analog out.  Given most speaker systems in existance today only have analog inputs/outputs... one would think they could keep this on here.  I know it adds expense and this is a good value but the extra 14 cents it costs could easily be added into the price.  I know there are converters and such but that adds more cables and points of failure.  Heck, the TV keeps the old composite/component inputs... and that's died off a lot sooner than analog audio has.  Oh well.Overall - This is a great choice for a TV for your regular house or living room.  If you need an extra TV or yours quit on you, this is the one for a very good price.  The TV that was replaced was a 7 year old refurb Vizio that served me very well but was very warm, only 720p(only... haha still great picture), and was starting to make a buzzing noise whenever on which was the deal-breaker.  So, this thing is awesome being a bigger screen but a much smaller TV, more energy efficient (aka not a hot screen!), and a great value with all you need and nothing you don't.

Reviews.Title: A solid compromise between price and quality
Reviews.Author: mhoyson
Reviews.Content: I purchased this TV about 2 weeks ago from a local store. I did a lot of looking around before making my purchase. At my time of buying, this was the cheapest 42" TV that I could find that had more than one HDMI input and was what I considered a name brand (not a TCL or Insignia, etc) I have an Xbox so I had no need to pay extra for a smart TV.Picture:The picture is certainly not the best that I've seen in a TV. That being said, it is noticeably better than my 4 year old Samsung 32" that I was upgrading from. FIRST THING, turn off E saver. It will prevent you from getting the best possible picture. The TV comes with a picture wizard, which I made use of to help me get a better picture. You can also google what other people think the best settings are. I took a few of these and combined them with my picture wizard results to get me to where I am. Having the TV set at 16:9 actually cuts off a bit around the edge. I set it to Just Scan, and it's looking better.Note: I have not noticed any gaming lag when playing first person shooters.Sound: As stated elsewhere, not this TV's high point. That being said, it's really not terrible. To get it clear, I have auto volume on, clear voice off, sound mode = music, virtual surround on. If you like immersing yourself in a movie, you may want to have a separate audio system to run it through.Other: No swivel on the stand. Easy enough to move by yourself. I sit about 10 feet away from the screen on a couch in a living room/kitchen room that's about 12x18. I wouldn't have gone any smaller but I don't think I made a mistake not bumping up to a 47" set.Summary:- 2 HDMI slots are all I needed- Picture isn't the best but with a little playing, it is better than most others in the price range- A worthwhile TV for the price

Reviews.Title: no bells and whistles but.........
Reviews.Author: Fin Jen
Reviews.Content: Everything I expected it to be.  Great picture, easy to use, good sound.  So far.......so good.  And the frame on the screen is almost nonexistent.  A 39 inch screen and the entire tv measures less than 41 inches diagonally.  That is pretty impressive.

Reviews.Title: Fantastic Television/Desktop Monitor
Reviews.Author: Lance A. Charles
Reviews.Content: First of all, ITS A TELEVISION - and keeping that in mind, this does a great job of that. No smart features, no internet just a tv with a really good display. The contrast is superb, and the colors are vivid but not overdone. The full 1080p makes watching hi-def content a pleasure and for secondary use as a desktop monitor, there is no noticeable lag when gaming (even without using the tv's own "game" setting). I'm a little confused as to where the headphone jack is - there is definitely a jack that's the right size (next to the 2nd HDMI port) but above it is written "Service Only" and when I plug the headphones into that the only sound produced is a rhythmic beeping. With that said, considering its size, the tv's own speakers produce a healthy sound. Bass is admirable and treble is very crisp, with clear mids as long as you keep the volume below half (easy to do). I cant relate to the other review about the "turning - on" issue as mine worked just fine upon arrival and first setup. I've been using it for a week now as both a television and computer monitor.

Reviews.Title: My second purchase of the LG 42" lower end TV is as good as my first.
Reviews.Author: Deepsea21
Reviews.Content: You can read my review of this TV's former model... The 42LS3400.  And I am pleased to report that since I posted that review the same LG TV is still performing perfectly.  So... My mom and dad are getting up there in age and I think they need a big TV as their eyes aren't what they used to be.  They told me they were happy with what they had but I knew they needed bigger and better.  Especially as mom refuses to get her cataract surgery.  I looked for the same model I purchased before but it is was no longer available.  However, I find this one and it has the same back-lit LED for superior picture quality without all the bells and whistles they'd never figure out to use.  I buy it, take it to their house, and set it up.  Right away they saw the difference between HD and the standard definition they were used to forever.  Mom and Dad are now calling me nightly to tell me about the HD picture and I'm like, "Yeah I know... told ya so".  It is a great TV for the price and with minimal help from me they figured out the remote controls and are now playing around with the various picture settings to find their own perfect picture.

Reviews.Title: good tv for the price
Reviews.Author: Frances
Reviews.Content: picture is what you would expect for 60Hz, sound is great, was hoping for a headphone jack but it doesn.t have one. very good tv for the money though. came very fast and was packaged well so no damage

Reviews.Title: Awesome picture. Mediocre sound...
Reviews.Author: BetaGeek320
Reviews.Content: Held out for years watching media on my laptop.Was waiting for a 39-40" LED/LCD TV for less than$350USD.  Did a fair amount of research, trying to avoidbrands that seem to have a lot of power supply problems(blown caps).Also wanted brand that made their own glass(LG supplies glass to Sony ;^))Read a lot of reviews.  This set seemed to fill the bill.Pros:  Excellent picture for sub $350USD TV.Using "Picture Wizard" utility, and setting the color temp.on the cool side, among several other tweaks, gaveme a very life like, clear and vibrant picture.Ran a few Blu-ray DVDs and was gobsmacked at thedetail and color fidelity in a room lit for evening viewing.I tried out the features on comparably priced TVsat the local stores, but this TV seemed to have the rightmix of set-up features to really set the picture the way YOU like it.As a photographer, getting the color temp., gamma, andpalette right is everything.  You have pretty much completefreedom to adjust these and more with this TV.Having watched cable and Blu-ray on this TV, the 60Hzrefresh doesn't seem to be a problem with me.There are adjustments to compensate for artifactsfor media that seems to look "better" or smoother at 120Hz refresh,but I haven't needed them.Cons: Sound is not great.  The small oval speakers point straight down.and sounds very "tinny" and hollow. Even with all the sound settings tweaked, the sound is atbest mediocre.Buy the TV for the excellent picture and wealth of settings, but at the same timeget a sound bar, or descent powered speakers.  Hi-Fi would be ideal.

Reviews.Title: Solid picture, weak sound
Reviews.Author: Stephen Levitan
Reviews.Content: Hook this TV up to external speakers and you have a great package at a very reasonable price. But if you care about sound, this TV is deficient on its own. Sound is thin and weak.

Reviews.Title: Good picture quality.
Reviews.Author: Jeanne Foster
Reviews.Content: The picture quality is very good. The TV is light and easy to move if needed. Easy to assemble. Would recommend.

Reviews.Title: Great TV overall with minor problems
Reviews.Author: J. Sapp
Reviews.Content: I purchased the 42" version of this at the local walmart with some gift cards.Pros- Once the settings are calibrated, the picture quality is excellent and the colors pop- Navigation is fairly simple- LG has great customer service- The sound get loud and the quality is okay ONLY if you've never hooked up your TV to an external audio system- Very sleek looking- I can't believe the refresh rate is only 60Hz, it seems much much smoother than my other 60Hz TVCons- Putting the stand together to make the TV stand upright and level is really difficult. After messing with this for over an hour I had to put some folded pieces of paper under the back of the stand to make it not lean backwards (will be investing in a mount) but I did succeed in making it level from side to side.- The remote doesn't feel sturdy and the buttons are too hard to pressI won't put this in the cons section because most TVs today are like this, but I am sick of the glossy screens. I wish matte screens would start coming to TVs - they look so much better and the glare is significantly lower.I highly recommend this TV. The quality of the TV is enough but LG has proven itself to me many times. The last HDTV I had was Samsung and the two before that were Vizios, all of similar quality to this one (32-42", 720-1080p, etc). The Samsung was lacking a couple things that should be considered standard, like an audio out port. Samsung customer service was poor, too. I was pleased with one of the Vizios but the picture quality on the other was very sub par, and I've heard that Vizio isn't consistent with their quality like LG. I currently own an LG computer monitor and love it. I 100% recommend this brand and this particular TV.

Reviews.Title: GREAT TV!!!
Reviews.Author: Zac Rogers
Reviews.Content: This is the first TV I have ever bought on my own, and I couldn't be happier! Before buying it I did what every good shopper should do and read the reviews. Everyone saying that this TV has crappy sound must be old and need hearing aids. This tv has great crisp color and picture, and the sound is perfect. Not to mention the price! I looked all over for the same model and you can't find this tv for this same price anywhere! Very pleased with this purchase.

Reviews.Title: LG 32LN5300 32-Inch LED-lit 1080p 60Hz TV
Reviews.Author: Jerseygirl
Reviews.Content: Great picture.Easy set up. Lots of features like sleep timer. Easy to use remote. I would recommend for any room.

Reviews.Title: broken for second time in 6 months
Reviews.Author: Susan
Reviews.Content: I ordered this in September. A month later it will not stay on.. Got it repaired- with no big problem, but huge inconvenience. This morning, it has happened again. I am calling for a repair order after I write this review. No more LG for me.

Reviews.Title: So far, so... great
Reviews.Author: Alberto Cortez
Reviews.Content: I read a majority of the reviews on here before I bought, I was deciding between this and a Samsung smart tv (32") and I didn't see the value buying the Samsung especially considering my PS3 would be connected to it for all my media activity anyways (Netflix, Hulu, Amazon Prime, Youtube, WWE Network, Crackle etc.). For a "dumb" TV it is quite simply powerful and beautiful. Great picture, even out of the box. I did look online for the preffered picture settings and spent a few mins setting it up to optimum picture quality and am very pleased with this purchase. Dollar for Dollar its the best TV I own or have ever bought. It will get a lot of use in my household for movies, blu-ray, and gaming so it will definetly be put to the test. I also like the remote, very intuiative and compact. Only gripe is the bottom red light that is under the LG logo stays on after the TV is turned off (going from blue or white to red when powered off), not very annoying but would rather have it always off, maybe I can figure out a way to turn it off in the settings. Otherwise great purchase. Have not had any power or issues with the set turning itself off during use but will update if those issues present themselves, as a few customers have made light of that issue, fingers crossed and everything is great so far.Picture: 10/10Sound Quality: 9/10 (havent cranked it up all the way, but its in a small bedroom and the sound is plenty loud and clear even at 15 out of whatever it goes up to, other reviewers knock it for its less than theathre sound, for the price I think its more than adequate I dont expect at IMAX quality at this price point)Ease of Use: 9/10 (alot of picture settings are self explanatory but for others unless your an image quality enthusiast you have no idea what they mean and you will subsequently toy around till you get the picture you want)Aesthitics: 8/10 (would rather not have the red indicator light when powered off)Connectivity: 8/10 (would have prefered an audio out headphone connector to be available, and wish both hdmi ports were together but otherwise great set up)Remote: 10/10 (it serves it purpose, very good remote)Value for Price: 10/10 (feels worth every penny, picked it up at a reasonable price $274.99 through amazon prime, and had a very speedy delivery)Overall: 64/70 = 91% Solid A rating. I may be a little generous at times with the score but I am impressed with the preformance and overall look of this TV.Bottom line I would definetly reccomend anyone looking for a good 32' to purchase this unit.

Reviews.Title: Love It!!!!
Reviews.Author: John Boy
Reviews.Content: Simple installation, and just a great picture and sound.  I've had it for a couple of months and I could not be any more pleased.

Reviews.Title: Great tv for the price
Reviews.Author: A. Martin "Amart"
Reviews.Content: I've had this a month. Very happy with picture and sound. Perfect for my Apple TV  not complicated.  Reviewed smart TVs first but glad I followed lots of advice I spent  the same amount for tv and Apple TV since I have apple products.

Reviews.Title: Pretty sweat
Reviews.Author: Zach Merritt
Reviews.Content: Having been in the market for a TV, I decided to go with this brand/model because of my experience with LG products. Needless to say I wasn't disappointed. It was shipped within two days of ordering and I had it two days later. The stand attached to the TV easily and within 10 minutes I had it up and running. Picture is bright and clear, although I can't comment on HD features because I'm using a basic cable box setup. For gaming purposes the picture is incredible. I have yet to detect any motion blur or any distortions whatsoever. The sound is fine for its purposes. Overall this is a solid TV and well worth the money.

Reviews.Title: Exactly what I ordered
Reviews.Author: Jonny
Reviews.Content: Tried to find a decently priced TV between 39 and 42 inches. This is PERFECT. Awesome video quality, sound isn't too bad either. BUY IT.

Reviews.Title: Great used T.V.
Reviews.Author: Alisha Everts
Reviews.Content: Great 42 in. LG t.v love the size and make. My first large HD t.v I bought for myself. Thanks so much Amazon for giving me a good price for this Great used t.v. Looks new and works good.

Reviews.Title: Amesome working TV
Reviews.Author: Jason
Reviews.Content: This TV is absolutely beautiful and was a great purchase, with chrome cast it makes streaming videos quick and easy and like cable!

Reviews.Title: Great TV for the price
Reviews.Author: Keenan Williams
Reviews.Content: I bought this TV to play my new Xbox one on. Like most of us, my eyes are HD spoiled, so when I am watching a TV that is grainy it really chaps my ass. This picture quality is great! I havent had any issues at all. I dont think its a TV thats big enough for a medium to large living room, but its great for the bedroom. Looking to save money, and get a quality picture? Buy it already and stop reading hundreds of reviews!! LOLP.S. Wouldve given it 5 stars but the lack of HDMI ports

Reviews.Title: Great, versatile TV/Monitor
Reviews.Author: Nick
Reviews.Content: I bought this TV from Amazon about a month ago and have been using it daily since then. I live in a small studio apartment so this monitor pulls double duty as a television and a computer monitor. I bought the 32" model and it's just perfect for watching TV from my bed or sitting close-up at my desk to get a really big picture.About 10% of its use is as a television. As a television it's great. The picture quality is sharp and the colors are vibrant. It's a full 1080p display, so HD channels look fantastic on this. The built-in speakers are fine, nothing to write home about. Basically what you'd expect for built-in speakers on a budget television. They produce sound, and that's fine with me.The other 90% of the time I use this as a computer monitor. I'm running my gaming PC directly into the TV with an HDMI cable. I couldn't be happier with this thing. Obviously it's not the same as some of the high-dollar gaming monitors but it works just fine for me. Having such a big screen (32 inches is HUGE for a computer monitor) is really breathtaking. I play games like Battlefield 4 at 1920x1080 resolution and it's just a gorgeous, gorgeous display. I'm also a college student so I do a lot of writing, and at the native 1920x1080 resolution I can fit two pages side-by-side on an MS Word document. This makes it really easy to skim through an essay for proofreading, etc. This is a big improvement from my old 1440x900 monitor which would only display a fraction of a single page. The extra 500 pixels running lengthwise make a really big difference. My only complaint with this TV as a computer monitor is the way it displays text, but that's not the TV's fault. 32 inches is a little bit too large to sharply display text at 1920x1080p. I can write essays and read forums just fine, but I find myself needing to get up and give my eyes a break every now and then because the text is just a little too fuzzy (and that's AFTER making the necessary overscan/sharpness adjustments). But I reiterate that's absolutely not the TV's fault; it's just the nature of the beast. The tradeoff you make for running 1080p at 32" as a computer monitor is that you get really BIG and vibrant graphics in exchange for fuzzy text.So, overall: Five stars. My only complaint is the text issue, which isn't the TV's fault. If you're looking to use this as a computer monitor and your eyes are easily strained, don't buy it... Otherwise it's a great unit.By the way, I have not experienced the random shutting off problem that some other reviewers have complained about. Knock on wood.

Reviews.Title: Great TV and I got it for a great price
Reviews.Author: Ricus
Reviews.Content: I went to the local national chain store and I was looking at the 24" 720/60Hz that was on sale. Anyway the main feature that I wanted was the ability to have it act as an alarm clock ("On Time"). I decided that 24" was not large enough so I looked at the 29" before seeing the 32" at a lower price than the 29" set. Again keep in mind that I am looking at the 530 model that has 720P/60Hz.They had the Samsung 32" which was also on sale next to the LG 32LN530 set so I play around and I was able to adjust the picture quality to the same look as the Samsung which costs more. In reality the flesh tones were actually better on the LG 530 model, so I decided to purchase the LG530 which is 720P and I had not noticed that the box below this display was actually the 5300 series with 1080P. When the store rang this up the price was certainly much more expensive for this model (1080P versus 720P) so I balked at the price still thinking I was purchasing the lower resolution model. I took him over to where I picked up the box to show him that the price was advertised as less than $230 USD. He explained that the box I picked out was not the same as the model advertised but he reluctantly he called his manager and re-rung this TV as if I was purchasing the 530 model instead of the 5300. Needless to say I got an increadible deal plus they gave me a gift card for $15USD for some reason.So I took this home and set it up and yes the speakers are not very nice sounding if you do not change the settings. I set mine on the "Music" setting and fiddled with the trebble and bass so it sounds OK now. Remeber you have to set the picture and sound up for every input that you plan on using so it is not as simple. While it is true that it does not sound like an amped system, it is good enough for the bedroom and I can hear the voice tracks very well. This set has the feature that I wanted that allows me to use it as an alarm clock which is actually the reason that I purchased this model.In addition, I had an older ROKU that I had not used in a while so I added that to this TV making it a "Smart TV". Overall the quality is really good especially at the reduced price that I accidentally got it for.I am very happy with the picture quality and stock "adjusted" sound and you could use this as your main TV or a bedroom TV but in a living room or family room you might like it better with an amp system with some better speakers.Hope this lasts a while.

Reviews.Title: A Nice TV
Reviews.Author: Jill Lippert
Reviews.Content: Its strange that 42" seems small these days, but this is a nice TV and good for a smaller room. The picture quality is good and no big set-up needed. It was delivered on time. No issues

Reviews.Title: Has A Beautiful Picture
Reviews.Author: Jim Elrod
Reviews.Content: This LG 32" LED TV has a very clear, vivid, and colorful picture. The TV's built in speakers sound quality is very good too. Once you down load the user's manual from the internet. The set up for this TV is very easy to do. I like that you can connect a external hard drive, and watch what ever you have on your external hard drive. Plus, you can use the remote control to control the external hard drive too.

Reviews.Title: Great image quality at a good price
Reviews.Author: Manki
Reviews.Content: This is exactly what I wanted: a TV with great image quality, but without funky features that I'd almost never need. This is not a smart TV, which is a plus for me. I connected a Chromecast to this, and it has all the "smartness" I need. I'm pleased with this purchase.

Reviews.Title: A Rare, Small-Screen 1080p HD TV
Reviews.Author: BookwormX
Reviews.Content: Excellent, sharp 1080 picture, but the audio quality needs to be improved. The speakers sound like they're in a little plastic box. There is no auxiliary audio output jack other than the optical output, so any optional speakers have to be connected to the audio jacks on your cable modem and/or BluRay/DVD player. This is one of only a few small-screen TVs that have HD-quality 1080p. Most small-screen TVs are only 720p.

Reviews.Title: Didnt live up to the hype
Reviews.Author: gatorgrad
Reviews.Content: I had a Vizio smart tv and returned it for LG. Big Mistake. This TV is fine but the vizio picture was so so much better. I was being a Brand snob and just knew the LG would be better and it was about $100 cheaper. I told myself i didnt need a smart tv. I didnt need 3 hdmi ports, usb port, audio out jacks, 2 sets of those other (red, white, green) thingys. When i plugged the vizio in I was blown away. when I plugged this in I thought ehh....it could be better. But its fine, audio is fine. settings are easy to get too. cable input is normal (vizio is vertical which is stupid)

Reviews.Title: Nice Picture.
Reviews.Author: joyce hazard
Reviews.Content: I haven't had it long enough to get used to an HDTV to rate that, it's my first.  But it has a nice picture and seems easy to adjust.

Reviews.Title: Wonderful Product - Definitely recommend Product & Seller
Reviews.Author: ckc
Reviews.Content: Excellent TV.  Got it as a gift because I am so pleased with the LG I have.  They absolutely love it.  It was time to upgrade their old console TV into the new era!

Reviews.Title: a good tv
Reviews.Author: James Hudson
Reviews.Content: an excellent tv ,showed up in good condition, set up easy , i hope to enjoy it for many years.

Reviews.Title: Meets my expectations
Reviews.Author: J. Lo. "Joe Tune"
Reviews.Content: Good performance.  Picture quality and ability to make changes on programs works well.Getting used to operating the hand held control so far.

Reviews.Title: excellent quality for its price
Reviews.Author: Thomas DiMaggio
Reviews.Content: I bought it on a great deal from this website, and I have to say, for this size, it's a great HD TV at 1080p. Not too many inputs, but I can settle for that when you're paying this little. Buy a receiver to give yourself all the inputs you want if that's what's stopping you.

Reviews.Title: The best!
Reviews.Author: Leilah Lewis
Reviews.Content: The tv was delivered in record time!!!! And it was in perfect condition. We have been enjoying its crispness in color and great sound. What a deal!!! I think one of the very best transactions I've had on amazon.

Reviews.Title: LG Flectronics LN5300 39LN5300 39-inch LED-lit 1080p 60HZ TV
Reviews.Author: Shirley Goins
Reviews.Content: I give the tv a four star, great color  great picture, this is the first time I have every own a LG tv, I hope it lasts a long time.

Reviews.Title: Great value
Reviews.Author: David Loibl
Reviews.Content: TV is as advertised. I use it as a monitor for my computer (HDMI) to watch netflix and listen to music. The speakers aren't great, but with my small apartment it's easily loud enough to hear in any room.

Reviews.Title: LG LN5300
Reviews.Author: Juneau John
Reviews.Content: This monitor replaces a 10-year-old Philips 32-inch monitor.  The most noticable improvement was picture quality, which I expected considering the LG monitor has 1080p lines of resolution vs the Philips 1080i lines; also the LED back-lighting system is a major improvement.  I am using an external sound bar, but the initial use of the monitor's speakers was good but not great sound.  Controls and menus are easy to figure out and use routinely; the initial set-up of the monitor was fast and efficient using the supplied instructions.  The CD-ROM manual is very helpful in finding and using all the features and systems.  I am very pleased with this purchase; reading over one hundred reviews before purchase really helps make a good choice.  This monitor is used to watch cable TV via an HDMI interface, Blu-Ray and DVD via the second HDMI interface, and DVD via the component inputs; all with excellent quality, improved over the older monitor.  Finally, the LG monitor fits in exactly the same space as the old monitor did, but with 10 more diagonal inches of screen.

Reviews.Title: Nice.
Reviews.Author: J.B. Taylor
